title: Loping Cinder dropping a hint as to Brands new lore dirrection in Bards Q&A?
body:
> Bard is not omnipotent, as a spirit he can be banished, powerful magics could potentially imprison him, and a force of equal power could possibly end him.

With the retcon of the IoW and by proxy the Rune Wars, Brand is one of the champs left in the 'Lore Retcon Void'. Being an [alluded to] unwanted causality in the chaos from uninhibited and unrestricted rune warfare of times before the creation of the Institute of War. Which the IoW was created to prevent more rune war catastrophes.

Who better to do the lore retcon of Brand than someone named Loping Cinder! "Powerful magics could potentially imprison him" is oddly very specific, as Brand is an elemental spirit that was imprisoned in a cage of True Ice. Perhaps Malphite and Brands new lores will have them be akin to the Bards and Sorakas. Bard is the sprinkly spirit that inhabits that ball of hair wielding a flute, Brand is a fiery spirit that inhabits the body of Kegan Rodhe. Sorakas original form could have been one of sprinkles as well but her punishment for turning a serial killer chemist into a werewolf (to you know, help with the murdering..?) was to be banished from the celestial club and her mortal form is that of her current unicorn self.

Perhaps these celestial spirits that Bard and Soraka come from not only possess benevolent spirits but also malevolent (Brand) and neutral (Malphite) spirits as well? 

Thoughts?

I'm not much of a Brand fan, but I would encourage you and the rest of the team to take a moment at some point during the ideation process to come onto the forum and talk with community members who care about Brand, and have a real discussion. I'm obviously not saying you should post up your drafts for some massive crowdsourced review. However, I do think that the community would appreciate it if you had some meaningful engagement with them about where you want to take Brand or how you want to reinvent his character, with a real back and forth of ideas. I don't think it would just be PR: I imagine you might well gain some insights from that discussion. I don't know how long you've been into League lore, but there are lore community members who have spent **years** immersing themselves in League's lore, and even if they're not professional authors, I think that's a fantastic resource. It would be a shame to neglect it.

More than that, I think it's important not to view League's lore as a blank slate. I really don't think that's appropriate for a universe with an established history and years of community investment. I get that you guys are making changes. I also see that of late you've been trying to keep things "backwards compatible", with fewer "Trundlings" whereby a character is deleted and replaced with a new character with the same name, and I encourage you to keep up that trend. Community discussion is a good way to get a sense of what elements the community is most invested in. That doesn't mean you can't still choose at the end of the day to delete those elements, but if you do so, I think it should be with full awareness of that cost. If it's something that nobody in the community cares about, and you think you have an even slightly better idea, sure, why not, rewrite it. But if it's something the community really values, I feel "I think my idea's kind of better, maybe" should not be considered sufficient justification for a retcon.

As for Brand himself, I threw out some ideas in **[this thread](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4888328)**. I'd be delighted if you or other Narrative team members found them to be useful grist for the mill. But, as I wrote above, I'm not really that invested in Brand. There are people in this community who are, however, and I really, really think you should be talking to them. The element of surprise can be very exciting, but discussion with a community as passionate as this one can be quite enriching. Avoiding spoilers is all well and good, but I think you should also give some thought to avoiding the scenario of Brand fans logging in one day and discovering that you've completely retconned their favorite character without a single word of discussion.

Thanks for all the feedback CupcakeTrap. I also read your post on the Mountain teaser. 

No one is looking at League's lore as if it were a literal blank slate. The characters (Champs), nations, themes, colors, and tonality inform our work. We do view this as "useful grist for the mill".

> [{quoted}](name=Loping Cinder,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=VAAwjfZ0,comment-id=000200010000,timestamp=2015-03-10T23:56:44.613+0000)

> No one is looking at League's lore as if it were a literal blank slate. The characters (Champs), nations, themes, colors, and tonality inform our work. We do view this as "useful grist for the mill".

I'm very glad to hear it, and I'm sure Brand's fans are, too, along with the fans of other Champions slated for a rework. I think some prior community engagement will not only give you some ideas, and some useful feedback on your own ideas, but also make for a much happier reception of the changes that do come down the line. Releasing major changes without prior discussion is a good way to make what was intended as a "Mystery Gift" surprise into more of a "Fiddlesticks ult in your face" surprise.

In addition to Champions, I for one would really value some kind of discussion with Narrative, Art, and other such departments prior to major changes to the settings of Valoran, and in particular its various factions. I do get quite anxious about the possibility that I'll come by one day and find that you've completely torn down and rewritten Bandle City, for instance. The community is positively teeming with ideas for the various factions, and I think it would be a shame to just slap something down without some prior community engagement, early enough in the process that what gets said in that discussion might influence how it turns out.

I do want to stress the importance of timing. While post-release "Q&A" style discussions are enjoyable, they aren't really a substitute for meaningful community engagement; by the time you're holding the Q&A, most of the material is already locked in. When it comes to brand new Champions or settings, of course, the surprise reveal makes a ton of sense; those *are* blank slates. However, to the extent that the incoming material is an express or implicit retcon of established lore, I feel that the negatives of the "shock reveal" approach grossly outweigh the positives.

You probably got downvoted because this is not the place to talk about your gameplay experience.  You are in the Story and Art forums.  Story and Art Rioters have absolutely *nothing* to do with your gameplay experience.  Telling Loping Cinder about your issues honestly won't amount to anything.

It probably got deleted because I reported it for being in the wrong board.  What you were doing was attempting to hijack a conversation with your post, which had nothing to do with Story and Art. > No one is looking at League's lore as if it were a literal blank slate. The characters (Champs), nations, themes, colors, and tonality inform our work. We do view this as "useful grist for the mill".

As far as I know, you just as well might consider it as a blank slate. So far Riot seems awfully happy to just change and remove any champion it dislikes for/into new ones it does like, [which seems like an awful idea to me.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/LtBeg85P-characters-in-the-new-lore) It means to me there's an awfully good reason to not get invested in a character and thus, a story.

When you say revisit do you mean things like the Sion lore launch, the Rek'sai piece, or the new bios?

Just a side note because it has taken so long, what is with Singed and not having his bio made cannon for 2 years?

We ideate champions in partnership with game design and art. Sion's relaunch, the Rek'sai piece, and Bard's teasers are included in that effort.  

Regarding your side note: Let me ask.

Ever since WW and Soraka had their bios changed Singed's lore has been non-canon. 
Thank you for the reply.

Singed's lore is one of a number in serious need of attention. It has gone on far longer than we would have wanted, but we are exploring a format and approach to tackle all of them in the near future. Frankly, it's taken a while due to a lot of changes occurring in Narrative and the ongoing work we are already doing (as Loping Cinder explained, Narrative is embedded on teams that include those creating new champions and updating them as well as a number of others)..

It is important to sort out these conflicting bios particularly, and it's something that personally keeps me awake at night, but we're committed to tackling the issue and we are exploring a way to do all of them while providing something more satisfying at the same time. I can't go into it further than that because of the work being done by various teams and as I don't want to set false expectation on time line.

I know it's a "Coming Soon" response, which is never as good as a "Here it is!" post, particularly in the midst of such a long wait, but we share the pain of every bit of text out there that causes confusion and consternation. We'll be considerably happier when we've tackled them.

Right now, there's [valid reasoning to actively distrust Riot with my investment in characters](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/LtBeg85P-characters-in-the-new-lore), with at least one glaring and one relevant champion being the playable evidence, Trundle and Xerath respectively.
**
Would it be possible to talk about lore philosophies, similar as to how the balance team talks design philosophies? ** They don't reveal new champions or future updates, but they sure make it clear that they value strategic diversity, counterplay and strategic identities.

***

I feel like characters are just being rewritten as if they are a single word concept, instead of an already established character. (Xerath the self-made ascendant, Trundle the troll, a troll being a sadistic violent regenerating savage creature), and I think this will systematically destroy the trust between Riot and the reader up until the point where the reader doesn't *want* to get invested in a story anymore. How could you write an engaging story with a reader that actively tries to keep distached from anything you create?

Personally, I just bluntly lost faith in LoLs lore when one of my favorite characters, Trundle, got removed rather than expanded upon. I was *excited* for his rework and got smacked in the face. 
I feel like the only reason not more people talk about this is because they think it won't happen to their favorite, but that's an inefficient way to think about it. Once it does finally happen to *your *favorite, all the other outraged people already gave up and left. Your voice will just be alone, ignored in the mass.
And Riot hasn't exactly shown much regret about it either. The communication, definitely, but not the actual replacing of Trundle for this new troll.[ In fact, it seems you are quite happy with it.](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?p=36508044#post36508044)

Only reasons I'm posting here is because the rest of Riot is awesome and for some inexplicable reason I have the idea that if I bring[ valid reasoning ](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/LtBeg85P-characters-in-the-new-lore)as to why removing characters from LoL is just plain bad, I might get old Trundle back.

>If you want to be Trundle, the Plague Troll, that character still exists for you in all his glory, complete with classic voiceover and updated character art and visual effects. 

It has a limited, outdated VO, an unfitting model (*that's* supposed to be a runt?) and I won't ever hear a word of lore about my old Trundle from Riot again. How glorious...


***

But before that, Singed too might fall. Will he suddenly have morals? Perhaps he won't be a Zaunite scientist but a voodoolands witch alchemist seeking vengeance on those who destroyed his village. (On second thought, Singed doesn't have too much to change, surely you would be able to preserve the few traits he has.)

***

Apologies if this is a bit ranty, there's been quite a bit of build-up of anger and frustration since the Freljord event that started this all. Also, Carthage is looking ripe for an attack.
